wiki.content:
Charles Mingus - bass
 John Handy - tenor saxophone
 Booker Ervin - tenor saxophone
 Horace Parlan - piano
 Dannie Richmond - drums
 
 Recorded at 30th Street Studio, New York City, May 12, 1959
 Originally released on the album Mingus Ah Um, Columbia, 1959
 Dedicated to Lester Young
 
        
User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary:
Charles Mingus - bass
 John Handy - tenor saxophone
 Booker Ervin - tenor saxophone
 Horace Parlan - piano
 Dannie Richmond - drums  Recorded at 30th Street Studio, New York City, May 12, 1959
 Originally released on the album Mingus Ah Um, Columbia, 1959
 Dedicated to Lester Young

name: Goodbye Pork Pie Hat
comments: Just fine.
A JAZZ CLASSIC BY MINGUS AH UM
Atmosphere!
Makes me sigh every time, then it's just breath easy and all the tension drains away.
the original  Ah Um version is such a gem !

could EVERYBODY say farewell to chldhood , grow up ?
merci beaucoup reminding so gently , takes a gentleman to do !
its deep in my SOUL!!!!
precisely
YES !!!! I LOVE THIS
the most beautiful tribute I have ever heard
Lester Young, the Prez, beautiful player.... this is such a fitting tribute to one of the great tenorists
is just great :)
dream
reminds me of taxi driver film score really loverly

lester young is playing what he's feeling...beautiful homage to a world-class talent...the wonderful wearer of the the pork pie hat...with much love and appreciation for all you gave and all you left behind...lester young...rest in peace...
so good
One of my most favorite tunes
להתראות כובע עוגת-חזיר
Love this. I really like the Stanley Clarke version too.
